byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR, JENNIFER STEINHAUER and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: Congressional Republicans plan on acting immediately to repeal Affordable Care Act once Pres-elect Donald Trump is sworn in, but say they will delay effective date of any repeal, giving themselves several years to completely phase out law; strategy reveals degree to which any attempt at repeal will be complicated and politically perilous.

headline.print_headline: A G.O.P. Plan on Health Act: Rescind Slowly
headline.main: G.O.P. Plans Immediate Repeal of Health Law, Then a Delay

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Congressional Republicans plan to move quickly to repeal the Affordable Care Act, but they are also likely to delay the effective date....
lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans plan to move quickly to repeal the Affordable Care Act, but they are also likely to delay the effective date.
